means: 刺耳的声音，不和谐的声音

sentence.Network_en: All around was bubbling a cacophony of voices.
From its cacophony of sound, the room has suddenly become very still.
sentence.Network_cn: 本来众声嘈杂的屋子里,突然变得非常肃静.

sentence.Network_en: Instant cacophony as the crowd inched forward step by step, coming, they're coming!

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent.: from French cacophonie, from Greek kakophōnia, from kakophōnos 'ill-sounding', from kakos 'bad' + phōnē 'sound'

entry.tran: 刺耳嘈杂的声音;喧嚣的声音;嘈杂声
entry.def: You can describe a loud, unpleasant mixture of sounds as a cacophony .

example.ex: All around was bubbling a cacophony of voices.

means.word_mean: 1. a loud harsh or strident noise
